resources.string: Experimental UI Components installation API using MapboxNavigationApp facade.
Experimental UI Components installation API using MapboxNavigation instance.
Test the usage of MapboxNavigationApp which can manage lifecycles between a car and app.

Tests the selecting of an alternative route line. 

1. Long press a point on the map in order to get a primary route and at least one alternative route. 

2. Select an alternative route by touching it. The touched route should appear as the primary route and the previous primary route should appear as an alternative. 

3. Click start navigation and make sure the puck follows the selected route.

Tests overriding the default alternative route colors with custom colors. 

The screen should display 3 route lines. One blue line that represents the primary route line as well as a yellow line with a green border and a cyan colored line with a magenta boarder. 

This indicates the two alternative route lines have been colored with the custom colors indicated in the activity.

Displays two restricted sections of a route. 

You should see two dashed lines near the middle of the route that have a magenta coloring. 

The first line should end at an intersection with the second dashed line starting at the next intersection. 

During navigation the restricted section should vanish along with the rest of the route line.

Displays all road objects on a route line. It also displays upcoming road objects as the route progresses. 

 Upon starting the activity, you should see all the road objects present in the route in the form of text at bottom left corner of the screen.

Once you press start navigation, you should see upcoming road objects as you progress.

You would need a special access token to make this activity work.

Dynamically adjusts the traffic congestion on a route line. 

Briefly after the activity starts the traffic congestion on the route line will be randomly updated. 

Notice the route line is partially "vanished". There should be no redrawing or blinking of the "vanished" section of the route line.

Dynamically adjusts the traffic congestion on a route line using the numeric congestion source. 

Briefly after the activity starts the traffic congestion on the route line will be randomly updated. 

Notice the route line is partially "vanished". There should be no redrawing or blinking of the "vanished" section of the route line.

The inactive leg of the route should be colored differently than the active leg. 

When the activity starts you should see a route with a waypoint roughly in the middle. Notice the styling of the route which includes traffic congestion. 

Start navigation and the second leg of the route should change color. 

When the puck reaches the waypoint and transitions to the second leg the first leg should take on the coloring of the second leg and the second leg should appear as it did before navigation with the traffic congestion markers.

Same as the inactive route route leg styling activity with the addition of route restrictions and the vanishing route line.

The restricted section starts at the end of the first leg and the beginning of the second leg. The restricted section is colored magenta.

The restricted section on the second leg won't appear until the second leg becomes active. The magenta dashed line should vanish beneath the puck with the rest of the route line.

The line used for representing traffic congestion can display a gradient transition between colors or hard stops between colors. 

This activity lets you toggle between the two styles. 

When selecting between hard and soft gradients you should see the traffic line change, reflecting the option chosen.

Screen to test feedback in ActiveGuidance and FreeDrive. Click on "START NAVIGATION" button to start FreeDrive session or long click on the map to get a route from current location to tapped and then click "START NAVIGATION" button to start ActiveGuidance session. Then you can observe in logcat how feedback is sent by clicking on `Feedback` button on the screen.
No upcoming rest or service area
No upcoming toll booth or gantry
Utility for testing customized Drop-In UI.
Utility for testing Drop-In UI in a fragment.

Utility for testing Drop-In UI lifecycle with fragments. Verify the lifecycle by filtering logs with "navigation_view_lifecycle_debug".

When a fragment is swapped, the previous fragment and its NavigationView should both reach the destroyed state.
When a NavigationView is detached it should be stopped and resumed back when re-attached.

Detaching a NavigationView and then swapping fragments should not leak.

Tests basic route line related functionality. 

You should see three route lines on the screen. The blue line is the primary route line. Selecting alternate routes should change the colors such that the line touched turns blue indicating it is the primary route. 

One important use case to observe is: 

1. Hide the primary route. 

2. Select an alternative route. 

3. Notice the route selected becomes the primary route and then disappears, maintaining its state as hidden, while the original primary route line appears colored as an alternative.
